intro: Leucas spicigera, commonly known as the spike leucas, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features small, pink to purple flowers arranged in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leucas spicigera is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
